title: [Large-scale] Understanding and Applying the Zero Product Property in Algebra

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary algebra (solving equations, polynomial operations)
context.additional_context: Students may struggle to connect theoretical concepts to real-world problem-solving; abstract concepts are concretized through student engagement activities

learning_goals: Students can accurately state the Zero Product Property (ZPP) and use it to solve equations with polynomial and integer coefficients.
Students can understand the concept of zero-divisors and identify cases where the inverse of ZPP does not hold.
Students can justify algebraic properties used in problem-solving processes both linguistically and symbolically.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
